website_summaries.verdict: If you're an iOS user looking to schedule lights and appliances to turn on and off through a single app, then Insteon's HomeKit-compatible Hub fits the bill, and it has the potential to get even better, but as of now, it's too limited to recommend.
pros: The Insteon Hub Pro is a straightforward control device for HomeKit-compatible gadgets, and it's positioned to get better and better as HomeKit improves
Controlling a device using Siri is a natural fit
cons: The Insteon Hub Pro isn't Android-friendly, and at this point, it isn't compatible with as many gadgets as the existing Insteon Hub -- no cameras, no motion detectors, no door or window sensors
Performance wasn't as reliable as we would have liked, either

customer_reviews.title: We love it.
customer_reviews.text: I have had Insteon devices since November 2017 and we are very happy with them. We use this hub along with 8 outlets and 5 switches downstairs in our home and they work great. The setup on some of them were a little tricky but overall went well and once the setup was completed everything works flawlessly with Alexa and with the app. I have purchased some additional outlets and switches that will be installed once i get an electrician out here again. I have multiple scenes setup that work great as well. We love giving one command to Aalexa each night and the whole downstairs shuts down :)
customer_reviews.author: ClickChick

customer_reviews.title: Third replacement of this product since 2015.  Garbage product and company.  Don’t waste your money.
customer_reviews.text: In December of 2015, after a lot of research, I selected the Insteon platform for my home automation. That decision has proven to be a mistake. I just ordered my 3rd Insteon hub. The last one I ordered was in July 2018 and it only lasted until a week ago. It leaves me to wonder if this isn’t the Insteon business plan using planned obsolescence. Their other devices (switches, plugs...etc.) have lasted with no issues. Oh and forget customer service, they flat don’t care. This is the last Insteon purchase I will make. I will now begin a phaseout of Insteon products with Alexa products. If you are considering purchasing this product don’t. Save yourself some frustration, Insteon sucks.
customer_reviews.author: A. R. Jaschke

customer_reviews.title: Will probably die on you in a couple years.
customer_reviews.text: This hub is terrible. They only last about two years before the capacitors blow and then you have to buy a new one because insteon does not stand behind their products. I'm here buying my 3rd hub because I have a bunch of insteon switches which are pretty useless without a hub. Every time you get a new hub you have to reconfigure all your devices because the whole configuration is tied to the physical device and can't be transferred to a new one. If you're just starting out I would choose another brand. I like their switches but the hub is very poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Matt D

customer_reviews.title: R.I.P.  32 month lifespan
customer_reviews.text: Really disappointed in this hub. I purchased in Nov '15 and it died two weeks ago. Lasted 32 months. This sits on a shelf in air conditioned room and dead already? This has got to be design problem. I have 2-way repeaters installed on mtn tops for PD, SO, Fire that have been operating for 15 years. Previous to this, had home control running on PC with USB Link module. It lasted about 3 or 4 years. Really wish there was alternative for Insteon devices. Still researching before I'll buy another hub.
customer_reviews.author: MJD-Wyo

customer_reviews.title: Very disappointing Hub
customer_reviews.text: This controller has been problematic. The thing only allows one device to be programed with sunrise and one to be programed with sunset. So limiting. There is no random or offset to make it look like poeple are really in the house. It has lost it's time setting. Tech support is non-existent. Read the forum for sad stories of customers waiting for help many days. Now I have $1000 or more invested in Insteon devices. Arrrgh!
customer_reviews.author: GKoehl

customer_reviews.title: Absurdly limited functionality combined with almost unusable UI
customer_reviews.text: I have several insteon enabled devices, but one critical "scene" I require is to turn on 2 devices at sunset, then turn one off at 10pm and the second at 11pm. All "scenes" must start and end at the same time, and apparently if one scene takes the 'sunset' slot, no other scenes can use it. The UI is counter-intuitive and absurd in it's entirety. My guess is that underlying server APIs are totally broken so the UI is unable to provide anything resembling a modern user experience. The only plus is that the one device I've been able to attach has been pretty reliably turned on and off.
customer_reviews.author: C Manton

customer_reviews.title: Hub replacement procedure is archaic, time consuming and support does not help.
customer_reviews.text: My Insteon Hub died, blown capacitor and transformer. I ordered this one to replace it. Insteon web site says you have to delete all your devices and your online account in order to install a new hub. With my hub down, the app will not connect to do that. So now you have to contact them to do it for you. I sent three email and am still waiting for them to delete the original account and the devices so I can connect the new hub to my devices. I gave up and ordered Wemo devices to replace the Insteon. I will eat the cost of the new hub and be done with it.
customer_reviews.author: L. R. EVANS

customer_reviews.title: Died after less than two years
customer_reviews.text: I have had two Insteon hubs died on me between one to two years of use. Perfect timing when the warranty just expired. What electronic devices that last less than two years now a day. There's definitely flaw in the circuit design that makes this device died prematurely. I used a UPS with surge protection so there shouldn't be a power surge that killed it. A pain was that I had to create new account and recreate the whole scenes and add all my Insteon devices all over again. Worse yet I need to use a different email account every time I set up a new hub. Stay away from this Insteon hub.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin L

customer_reviews.title: Second hub burned out, hmmmm
customer_reviews.text: I have two houses and have a hub at each location. One hub burned out Spring 2019 at one location and now my other hub has burned out. Hey Insteon, power supply issues? Please let us know!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Hubbard

customer_reviews.title: Breaks within a year
customer_reviews.text: These hubs fail in about a year. I have literally gone through 3x hubs at this point. All 3 of the hubs have failed the same way. The hub eventually stops powering on after about a year. I keep buying the hub because I haven't found another device to control all my insteon switches (If anyone knows of a good alternative, please comment). If you are thinking about using Insteon don't. The switches themselves are already fairly expensive and painful to replace. It's a horrible investment considering the hubs need to be replaced every year.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Castaneda

customer_reviews.title: I wouldn’t do this again....
customer_reviews.text: Ordered this product 12/2018 to replace an identical hub that totally stopped working...had to pair each of my 28 insteon devices one at a time...very tedious. I have several echoes that I used to verbally control my scenes and individual devices. I tried several times to pair the new hub with Alexa to no avail. Finally, after more than 3 hours on the phone with Amazon tech help and then being referred to Insteon tech help, I was told the devices’ software was apparently in compatible. I was promised a call back with a work-around but it never came! I now have to control all my Insteon devices thru the Insteon app on my iPad...
customer_reviews.author: Mickey Waggoner

customer_reviews.title: STOP DO NOT ORDER THIS HUB!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: If you have panels more than a few years old this won't work. No where, in their documentation does it say that! Everything I could find says it supports six and eight button panels and that is all. Now Insteon support is saying my 8 button panels cannot be configured by this hub because they are too old. Probably a good piece of information that should be included in the specifications or documentation of comparability... WHICH I READ!!!!! Maybe they don't document the facts on purpose....sell you the hub...now you have to spend another two or three hundred dollars to replace perfectly good switches... pretty slick indeed.
customer_reviews.author: Russell Beard

customer_reviews.title: Alexa integration, Stringify integration
customer_reviews.text: Works with insteon devices and Alexa will let you group with other vendors home automation products - excellent. Also set up complex scenes with Strigify. A word of caution though, if your hub goes bad, this will not drop in its place. You will have to setup all your devices again. Before ordering to replace a bad unit, contact smarthome/smartlabs, they may be able to save you headaches.
customer_reviews.author: Skubidew

customer_reviews.title: Cannot Get this Insteon Hub to Work with Alexa and the On-Line Assistance is Worthless
customer_reviews.text: I had a previous Insteon Hub that worked for three years, then failed, so I purchased a second one. However, the Insteon Hub and Alexa will not connect. I have entered all the new codes and links on the Apps, but this one will not connect by any means. I am no longer recommending the Insteon Hub. I have a significant investment in the switches, plugs, and sensors, but that does me no-good unless the Hub is working. Now, I just have a bunch of junk.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Can't Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I bought this too bridge between my Google Home and my Lutron WiFi switches. While the description claims compatibility, the reality is that it requires a convoluted custom setup that is both difficult and unreliable per the written documentation offered by other owners. I have a lot of smart home equipment, this is the only element that wasn't an easy and intuitive setup. It's sitting on my media cabinet gathering dust :(
customer_reviews.author: BookMARK

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy this, it is not reliable!
customer_reviews.text: Works fine for a few days, then I have to power cycle it to get the thing working again, big mistake getting this Hub. Do not have this problem with other home automation brands, only Insteon. Every few years I purchase some Insteon products to see if their reliability has improved, but it never gets better, guess they will never figure out how to make reliable products. The whole point of home automation is to make things easier to control, if you spend a lot of time maintaining the system then it has no value, Insteon should have figured this out by now!
customer_reviews.author: John Rix

customer_reviews.title: If you are out of the house or worse, out of town
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a leak sensor with the 2245-222 hub. It detects water leaks, but when it does it sends an email message to my iPhone every 8-15 seconds until the leak sensor is reset. If you are out of the house or worse, out of town, your email inbox will overflow and your iPhone will receive a text message every 15 seconds until you can get home and reset it. I called Insteon and they told me it was designed that way and I had no control over how many messages (email or text) I received. This is a terrible design.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Easier than I thought!
customer_reviews.text: I installed several hard wired Insteon light switches and used the hub to control them. Set up was easy - I plugged it in and scanned the QR code using the app. I figured out how to add the switches easily. I had a problem when I got to a 3 way switch but tech support helped me pretty quickly - turns out I only had to add one of the 3 way switches, and the other one worked automatically. We have 10 different switches in our master suite, so making a “scene” with the app that turns them all off at once without getting out of bed made my wife pretty happy!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Poor Reliabilty
customer_reviews.text: I have owned switches and wall switches for 15 years or more. I have had good success with the switches and modules, but the central controllers just plain fail after a few years. Few means 1 - 3 years. My current controller failed after only one year. Invest in another technology.
customer_reviews.author: B. Semple

customer_reviews.title: Great product if you don't expect too much from it
customer_reviews.text: The Insteon hub works well once it's set up properly. It is true that you have to pair the hub to each of your devices, but you don't have to go back and forth between the hub and the device if you add them via the Insteon Android/iOS app. Management of the devices I already have is actually much easier using the hub rather than using the 'set' button on each device to set up scenes and responders. Amazon Echo was easy to set up to work with this hub and it's quite a bit more reliable than the Philips Hue bridge that my Echo is also connected to.
customer_reviews.author: A root

customer_reviews.title: Insteon disappoints
customer_reviews.text: I've had 3 of these things. 2 of them failed. Very poor design. The biggest disappointment though, is that the 2245 does not support X10 - making a lot of my home equipment obsolete. NOT UPWARD COMPATIBLE. The website does not work properly - they depend on a smartphone app which is OK but if you are putting a website online, it should work. Very poor support - if you have a choice, don't buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Renner

customer_reviews.title: Customer Service is so terrible there's no point in buying the products. AVOID!
customer_reviews.text: Product might be good but if you ever need customer service or help, you should make sure to clear your calendar for a week. Customer service is TERRIBLE. Plan on holding for a few hours or waiting a few days for an email response asking you to call customer service. It's just not worth the trouble. If you want connected home products try anything other than Insteon. I'm ready to rip out the $2000 system I installed because every time you have a question you lose weeks of your life trying to get help.
customer_reviews.author: Tech geek

customer_reviews.title: Skip them.
customer_reviews.text: They work, but only for now as the Internet of Things is going a different way than Insteon. Their android app is probably the worst app I have ever seen. It looks like it was made 10 years ago and is garbage. Look at its reviews on Google Play. They don't care. It does NOT work with Smart Things. No customer support. God help you if you need to change our the Hub. All in all, it is good...if you were buying this 5 years ago. But almost every single competitor of theirs is doing more, has a better app design, and is cheaper than Insteon. My advice, leave Insteon where they are comfortable and work in, the past.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Me

customer_reviews.title: Failed just 2 weeks out of warranty.  Common issue that is reported on their own forums.
customer_reviews.text: Worked well, until it died.. just 2 weeks past the end of the manufacturer's warranty. Reading on the insteon forums, it appears that they used a cheap, unreliable capacitor that commonly fails after 1-2 years of use. I have ordered a replacement cap, and will be replacing the old one to see if that fixes things, but a (at the time I bought it) $100 hub should last quite a bit longer than 2-weeks past the warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Insteon must be tired of online bad rap... Making good!!!
customer_reviews.text: The recently did an update and unfortunately it turned my hub into a brick. However not only did they happily replace my unit but they even programmed it so I didn't have to go back through and find all the mac addresses on the switches, alarms, modules, and fan pieces. They will keep my business.
customer_reviews.author: Corry

customer_reviews.title: Product does what it is supposed to do.....but
customer_reviews.text: This Insteon hub replaces one bought 3 years ago which has failed. This is a common problem with Insteon devices; they fail too soon. If I were starting fresh I would not use their products; unfortunately I have a large investment in smart switches and it would be quite expensive to replace all of them.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Siegle

customer_reviews.title: Beware! Incompatible with older Insteon devices.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this hub to control some older Insteon devices (wired-in dimmers and plug-in dimmers) as well as newer devices. The newer devices worked flawlessly, but I struggled with the older ones - just could not make them work. Finally called support only to discover that the firmware in the older devices (e.g. LampLinc V2 2456D3) is incompatible with the new hub - and there is no upgrade path. No exchange program either. My $400 investment in the older devices is now worthless.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Changed from 2 to 4 stars - System works well and support did, too
customer_reviews.text: Revised 1/19/16 Pros: Easy set up, easy configuration (except time), works w/ Echo Cons: Relatively weak signal (meaning, don't hide the hub in a credenza or closet, etc....) Okay, I just had a customer service experience 180 degrees from the first. Tech support was immediate and right on the money. I only have three (3) devices (all wall switches, 1 dimmer) and they are sync'ed with Echo. Grouped outdoor lights are on timer and now work as expected thanks to time adjustment. Echo/Alexa work perfectly with the devices.
customer_reviews.author: USERBOSCO

customer_reviews.title: Privacy nightmare and aggressive product registration.
customer_reviews.text: This device is a privacy nightmare. Insteon requires that you register for an account with their cloud service to use this device in a home. If you want to fire off RESTful API requests against the hub, you have to apply for an API key from Insteon to make it all happen, which they seem eager to deny. Devices like this hub that run on a local network should not require registration. I’ll be shipping this back to Insteon and reluctantly buying the PLM, which doesn’t require registration, but does require setting up a Linux server.
customer_reviews.author: Brad

customer_reviews.title: Stay far, far away.
customer_reviews.text: I sold all of my Insteon devices and completely left the company entirely. I've never owned such unreliable and frustrating technology in my entire life. Plus, looking through their extensive inventory of devices is quite misleading. Only some of them work with the hub. If smart lighting is your main focus get Hue or Lutron. I personally have Hue and love it. Lutron has been recommended by my electrician who installs the brand regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen

customer_reviews.title: Easy but requires completely re-entering all your devices.
customer_reviews.text: If you've worked with the previous Instead Hub version, this one will be a bit easier (no need for reconfiguring your router for port fowarding). But a basic gripe about this Hub - you will have to manually re-enter every one of your devices, scenes, and rooms. Insteon has no provision for saving the previous setup on its app and transferring it over to a new Hub. Very poor design on Insteon's part.
customer_reviews.author: JP7570

customer_reviews.title: Control everything with your iPhone and Alexa voice-control!
customer_reviews.text: I love controlling all the Insteon devices from my iPhone and Amazon Alexa. The previous owner of the house installed all Insteon switches. It took me a couple hours to register about a hundred devices to the hub with my Iphone. Now I have timed lights and fountains coming on, christmas lights automatically turning on. I was in Spain the other day and could see the status of all the lights in the house in California!
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Weak PC interface, no configuration backup, weak power supply.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third unit. The other two stopped working. Probably the power supply. They work well, but the Windows interface is not great. I much prefer to program it on my PC. There is no configuration backup, so when a unit fails, you have to call Smarthome to delete the account, then you have to reprogram it all over again. If you have several Insteon modules it takes quite a bit of time. The power supplies on all Insteon units are a weak design point.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Insteon Hub stopped working
customer_reviews.text: MANY reviews of how this dies after, literally, 2 years and a few months - just after warranty is up. Mine just died 2 years, 1 month out. Had to order an entire new unit as I am not sure how to replace the C7 capacitor, which is what some of the forum participants said to do. Amazing that they can time this out so well in the manufacturing process to die right around this time. Planned obsolescence......the way of today!!
customer_reviews.author: KellySophieBently

customer_reviews.title: GREAT with Amazon Echo!
customer_reviews.text: Updated an older hub to take advantage of Amazon Echo integration. Glad I did! It's a lot of fun to be able to have Alexa turn lights on and off (our house has an extensive Insteon installation) on command. And a lot more convenient when your hands are full. Highly recommended if you already have the necessary infrastructure for a smart home. The only issue I've found is that in rooms with a great many three-way circuits (our Rec Room has three), Alexa has trouble distinguishing which device to control. The hub could be better integrated if the Amazon Echo was also able to activate Insteon scenes, which can be scripted to control multiple devices.
customer_reviews.author: S. Moon

customer_reviews.title: NO support for Insteon I/O Linc with Alexa
customer_reviews.text: Works good until I discovered that it doesn't support all Insteon devices. I added an Insteon I/O Linc to control a device but then discovered that the Insteon hub doesn't make the I/O Linc device visible to Alexa. So it can't be controlled by Alexa and the Echo Dot. Fail. I should've bought the ISY-994i instead.
customer_reviews.author: Garino

customer_reviews.title: Don't Wast Your Money!!
customer_reviews.text: Junk! Don't waste your money on this product. I purchased this controller hoping to control a few devices, that I purchased at the same time. The only device that actually worked was the water leak detector. The insteon switch item: 2466SW would not connect to controller. The switch would work manually, but what good is that. Customer Service is a joke, although it matches there products. I returned it along with all the devices I purchased, and ordered the Samsung SmartThings hub. Everything installed correctly, and within minutes I had multiple devices working with Alexa. So save yourself some aggravation and order the Samsung SmartThings hub!
customer_reviews.author: D

customer_reviews.title: I like it!!
customer_reviews.text: So far I have only used it to control patio lights. Sometimes I at night after going to bed, someone will let the dog out and forget to turn off the lights which shine into my bedroom. Instead of having to get up and turn them off, I tell Alexa to turn off patio lights and back to sleep I go!!
customer_reviews.author: Paul G.

customer_reviews.title: So disappointed in their product
customer_reviews.text: Spent an hour resetting, submitting, researching and can not even get the HUB to connect with APP. So disappointed in their product. Also, have begun to see first two switches that we've had for 2 years begin to fail.
customer_reviews.author: ShopSmart

customer_reviews.title: Run, don't walk away from Insteon.
customer_reviews.text: I've owned two of these pieces of garbage and they've both broken in under a year. No hyperbole, the software is the worst I've ever used. Shame I'm stuck with all these insteon switches. If you're considering going with programmable smart home devices, run don't walk away from Insteon.
customer_reviews.author: J. Sink

customer_reviews.title: Great for simple home automation.
customer_reviews.text: Works as advertised. Bought this after a lot of research. needed something to turn our roof shingle/gutter heating wire on and off remotely. Worked perfectly via wifi through the winter, whether or not we were home. Wifi set up was quick and easy. Phone app works great. Can't vouch for how wide the signal range is, how the scheduled programming works, or how it works with multiple items. But as a simple device for remote on and off, it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: qbang

customer_reviews.title: Works but semi Unreliable
customer_reviews.text: It works until it doesn't every couple of months it will stop working and it does not have HomeKit support. if yOu are looking for light switches I suggest the luton Castea hub, Much better for reliability. I am switching all mine to luton
customer_reviews.author: Combchris

customer_reviews.title: Not wonderful
customer_reviews.text: Like Presidential candidates, it sounds better than it is. This is my fourth home automation system, and it's got the most unreliable link to Insteon devices that I've used. I've even added four Insteon range extenders around the house, and connectivity is unreliable. I had all devices showing green in the device status page. Now, two weeks later, it is only talking to the Insteon range extenders and to the remote controlled outlet for my hot water circulation pump. WTF?
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J. Shaker

customer_reviews.title: Just a pretty poor half baked product
customer_reviews.text: Just a pretty poor half baked product. It cannot find devices on your network, you have to manually link each one by pressing its link button. If you try to enter the device ID it just never finds them. The ONLY reason I don't return this is its Echo integration. I'll link a few devices for Alexa to control and not bother trying to do anything else with it. Its no ISY thats for sure. I've gotten used to beta grade half baked product releases from SmartHome over the years but this is among the worst.
customer_reviews.author: J. C. Thorne

customer_reviews.title: Works great until it goes out
customer_reviews.text: Works great until it goes out. Purchased in April 2016 and 16 months later it's dead. Will be ordering a third unit since I don't have time to research a competitive product that will last longer. If you have some time, do the research and if you find something, please comment as I'm sure we'll need a 4th in the not too distant future.
customer_reviews.author: Johnny

customer_reviews.title: ... replacement for one "same exact Insteon unit" that went bad right after the warranty expires
customer_reviews.text: Don't bother buying these as a replacement for one "same exact Insteon unit" that went bad right after the warranty expires. Not going to work! Insteon calls it a security feature, I call it a crappy product. Now I have to change all my switches to move to a better companies system because it all very proprietary.
customer_reviews.author: Linda L.

customer_reviews.title: Self monitoring system
customer_reviews.text: I have this product a little over a month, and would recommend it if you are looking to get out of monthly security payments. The products are individually price, and can be costly, with a few offered in a package. If you add up the monthly payment, installment fee, plus deposit you have to pay to security company you'll see the saving almost immediately. Work very well thus far with a notification send to my phone each time a door or window is open/closed. I hope eventually they will come up with away for owners to have link buttons for the police, ambulance, and fire department. I love it and would recommend it as an alternative to pricey security fee.
customer_reviews.author: L. Bee

customer_reviews.title: If Hub fails, you need to start over from scratch!
customer_reviews.text: I have been a big fan of Insteon and have it installed throughout my house. Unfortunately, last week my Insteon Hub died and I had to order a new one. Fair enough. Electronics sometimes fail. However, when I tried to install the new Hub, it said "unable". When I called Insteon support, I was told that if the Hub failed, the entire system programming needs to be redone -- scenes, etc. This is obviously absurd, but I was unable to get any further with their technical support. I will be calling a Lutron installer tomorrow with amazement and sorrow.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Power issues
customer_reviews.text: Works on my 3rd one insteon has same issue keeps burning out power supply even with a power surge protector of course the warranty expires then it goes,don’t have a choice need to keep buying have to much invested in insteon switches and leak detectors
customer_reviews.author: Karl Evans

customer_reviews.title: Biggest disappointment is you can't add or subtract time from sunrise ...
customer_reviews.text: Too simple. Can't access attributes of 6 and 8 button switches. Can't run more than one scene at a time (a house has more than one stage). Biggest disappointment is you can't add or subtract time from sunrise and sunset.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron

customer_reviews.title: Hardware fails far too soon.
customer_reviews.text: Hardware needs improvement. This unit seems to die for no obvious reason about as soon as the warranty runs out. The system also needs the ability to back up your settings and devices this stores as you'll have to start from scratch when it dies next.
customer_reviews.author: J.G.

customer_reviews.title: Automates lights
customer_reviews.text: Use this to automate a variety of lights in our house (this requires insteon light switches, which also work manually). Works well, better than other systems I have tried, though I had to replace the original unit after it failed at about 4 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon user

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my old one
customer_reviews.text: I need this to replace the one I have that burnt out after only three short years. These are known to go bad but you probably already knew that if your buying just the Hub. Insteon has made great strides since I bought my first camera from them but they need to upgrade the components in the Hubs.
customer_reviews.author: Ammoshot

customer_reviews.title: Mostly my fault for not enough research
customer_reviews.text: WHO IN THIS DAY AND AGE CREATES A DIMMABLE SMARTSWITCH THAT DOESN'T INTEGRATE WITH LED BULBS! Sure it works.. but only for tungsten bulbs.. might have been able to get it to work but also live in NZ so didn't think this base station would work without a transformer to get it to 120-240v mains. Looks to be pretty locked down so can't integrate out and just frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Keith Durrant

customer_reviews.title: Solid hardware terrible support and software
customer_reviews.text: This product has solid hardware they are not cheap however their technical support is non existent. For a week their server is down and tech support tells me they are working on it. There is no local control everything goes through their server if you use this hub. Hence when their server is down you can't control your system through local network.
customer_reviews.author: Ali

customer_reviews.title: Unreliable - 2nd hub that failed
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd hub that failed. AVOID this product
customer_reviews.author: Gundam

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Insteon app, but the service works beautifully with Alexa or Google Home once configured.
customer_reviews.text: Finally integrates beautifully with Google Home (as well as Alexa). This is the hub you want for Google Home or Alexa, not the more expensive model. Insteon is now awesome with either ecosystem (Alexa or Google Home). -1 star for terrible app from Insteon required to configure the hub and for Insteon's horrendous cloud service. But, once set up, works beautifully.
customer_reviews.author: D. N. Knisely

customer_reviews.title: Avoid if you don't do Apple
customer_reviews.text: This product is only being developed for iphones. Android app hasn't been updated since 2017, windows app even longer. Can't do many of the things you should be able to. I called tech support and they told me "log in with an iPhone". I don't have an iPhone.
customer_reviews.author: Hobz

customer_reviews.title: Controls X10 modules!!!
customer_reviews.text: Not sure if this is documented anywhere online, but you can control your existing X10 modules with the Insteon Hub. Downside is that it appears that only Insteon modules can be used with Scenes, but you can ***almost*** replicate this functionality by setting all X10 modules you want to trigger on/off to the same house and unit code and then set a schedule on one of them. For anyone tired of trying to make due with the European version of Active Home Pro program and CM15A transceiver for their existing X10 modules this is a welcome (and more reliable) surprise.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E. Runstein

customer_reviews.title: Mine died like many others 27 months after Purchase(24 month royalty)
customer_reviews.text: Mine died like many others 27 months after Purchase(24 month royalty). Now the only solution Insteon has designed is to go to every device, do a factory reset, then buy a new hub and painfully relink every switch and plug. This is both ludicrous design and quality. Very disappointing!!!.
customer_reviews.author: R. Knowlton

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This is not a good system. Hub will die after 2 years. You will not be able to use the same ID for a replacement hub. You will not be able to manually operate lights after creating a schedule for the lights. Epic fail.
customer_reviews.author: Mary D

customer_reviews.title: Terrible product and would avoid like the plaque
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this product and downloaded the installation app. Went through the process and hub was not detected. Watched their online installation instructions and their video actually is incorrect as it asks you to scan the bottom of the device as part of the start-up process; however the app never takes you through this step! Searched their online technical assistance and did all the steps without resolution of the problem. Even went to various forums for advice and everything I tried still did not work. Terrible product and would avoid like the plaque, at least from my experience. They need to get their act together and make a product that is easier to install.
customer_reviews.author: Starwander

customer_reviews.title: it connects great and now that it works with the Echo
customer_reviews.text: Software needs some help. For example, you can set an alert, but you can't schedule the alert. Meaning, I can have a text message to my phone every time a door opens...but I can't state, only between the hours of 10pm and 5pm. So, every day I have to set it when I go to bed or leave the house...then unmark through the day. Other than that, it connects great and now that it works with the Echo, even better....although only some devices.
customer_reviews.author: cdburns123

customer_reviews.title: ... 1 year 2 months I'm getting more and more disappointed with Insteon products
customer_reviews.text: Just died lasted 1 year 2 months I'm getting more and more disappointed with Insteon products.
customer_reviews.author: MELINDA SANTIAGO

customer_reviews.title: This thing won't get past setup. Internet connection is ...
customer_reviews.text: This thing won't get past setup. Internet connection is working perfectly. This hub is showing a green light as being connected. Have tried the phone app, the ipad app, windows store app (ethernet connection) and nothing can see this thing. Have reset this a number of time and it doesn't work. Do yourself favor buy another brand, and stay away from this thing.....
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Easy setup and functions well
customer_reviews.text: It was easy to set up and I am really enjoying being able to control my lighting, fountains, flood lights, landscape lighting, etc. from my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Joe A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t last long
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after the product return date. This is the 2nd one I had to replace. DON’T PURCHASE!
customer_reviews.author: Howie J

customer_reviews.title: Works but takes a little extra effort to understand the setup instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Have only installed three leak detectors so far. Do not have any experience with any other setup so I can not make a comparison. The controller and leak sensor were fairly easy to set up but it took a few tries to get the notification set up to suit my needs. It was not quite clear to me how to set up an account and get notifications. Had to go thru it 3 times before I figured out they were tied together. If you want phone notifications,you have to set up you user name as your number@your provider. It works and has already warned us of a leak from a reverse osmosis system I installed a couple days earlier.
customer_reviews.author: Gary Rice

customer_reviews.title: Garbage
customer_reviews.text: Insteon products are unreliable. ALL of mine have failed within a year. The replacement process for this hub is insane. The dimmer modules I bought for lamps have all failed, been replaced, and failed again. It's a coin toss as to whether or not a $45-$50 switch will work after a year of light use. That's unacceptable. There's huge potential in home automation but unless you have money to burn you should leave this alone for a few years until quality improves.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce L.

customer_reviews.title: Hub no longer works after 2 years
customer_reviews.text: Updated on Feb 2019: I contacted the company and they sent me a replacement with no charge. I changed my rating to 3 stars. It remains to be seen on how long this new one will last. Original Review: Very disappointed with this hub. After about 2 years, the unit no longer powers up. I opened it up and noticed burn marks on the circuit board. It's made in China so don't expect too much.
customer_reviews.author: Slingster

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, excellent performance
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why there are so many negative reviews for this product. I set it up in about 30 minutes, and that includes pairing 5 devices to it and programming scenes. Performance is fine and the app, while not the most user friendly, is reasonably straightforward to use. If you have a bunch of Insteon devices, this hub will let you control and automate them with ease.
customer_reviews.author: G P

customer_reviews.title: Total Waste of Money
customer_reviews.text: The app will not connect to the Hub. The Echo can't see the Hub. I've tried everything that insteon recommends to make it work. 2 hours waiting for tech support to answer, but they never did. Emailed tech support. Still no answer 2 days later. So far, this was a total waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: INSTEON Hub not really useful
customer_reviews.text: The INSTEON Hub seems to work fine - even though I found the setup procedure "daunting" to say the least. I did not realize that I had to d/l an "app" for the thing and I had no idea how to do that or where to go in order to get the app. Even though the Hub works okay, it is of little use to me as the HD Camera that I really needed, won't work in a Windows desktop environment. The factory knew this in advance. I only found it out thru technical support (2 hours on the phone to Calif.). So, the Hub is just sitting there doing nothing. I cannot recommend either of these devices.
customer_reviews.author: H.D.Munn

customer_reviews.title: Crap product in a captive market.
customer_reviews.text: I have had to buy two of these for each of two houses as they seem to have a design flaw that causes a component to fail destroying the printed circuit board in the process. However, there is nothing out there I know of to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel S. Farkas

customer_reviews.title: Device will fail in a year or two.  Trust the other negative reviews, their hubs are garbage.
customer_reviews.text: Trust the reviews -- this is utter garbage. I've had to replace the hub 3 times now due to known hardware defects. Sadly and regrettable, I made an investment in Insteon 10 years ago and installed over 25 of their switches throughout my house. Now I've no option but to continue dumping money in this company to replace their shoddy hubs as they fail.
customer_reviews.author: Steven

customer_reviews.title: Probably good for a novice.  Waste for me.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solely to be able to turn lights on and off with my Echo. The hub requires every device be added manually via smartphone. I already have a network of nearly 100 devices on an ISY994i. There was no way I was going to add every one of them in manually. Wasted $80 on this thing because now the Echo integrates with the ISY directly.
customer_reviews.author: S. Palermo

customer_reviews.title: The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup
customer_reviews.text: The nicest hardware for remotely connected switches I have come across. The app is not pretty, and it can be hard to setup, but once it's done it's worth it. I just hope the introduce Google home support soon. I use the homeboy app to control them, much nicer then the insteon app. Lots of tmdifferent hardware options, scheduling, scenes and all sorts of other things. High quality, and highly configurable.
customer_reviews.author: William Houston

customer_reviews.title: So far this works great
customer_reviews.text: I had been looking for a solution to turning on and off some lights installed on our house for the outside that do not have switches. The insteon hub and switches are working great and easy to use. The app on the iPhone is nice. I have even added a few interior lights so we can turn them on for the dogs if we get home late. The mini remote was not a very good item. i had to return it. I recommend using the hub for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: good, not good enough and missing critical feature.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it for the leak sensor. they both operate well, based on tests i did. alert is sent to the app and the email. However - there is no option to audio alarm to be activated at home. say you are in bed and there's a leak - you'll know about it only after turning on the smartphone or email. The "good" part is that i placed a question on the web site a week ago, but did not get a response.
customer_reviews.author: NK

customer_reviews.title: New device, ancient software, customer service? What is it?
customer_reviews.text: Extremely old firmware on a NEW device, software is clunky, unresponsive and slow. Support is difficult to reach and work with. I could say support is nonexistent. Save your time and money, shop around and stay away from Insteon products.
customer_reviews.author: Herr Hoffmann

customer_reviews.title: Good home control
customer_reviews.text: Got this to replace one which died just a few months out of warranty. They are easy to use for small to medium set ups. The app on iPhone is OK but just OK. It is limited in flexibility with things like multiple cameras or more than one thermostat. Things like the name of the device affect it's order in the displays.
customer_reviews.author: AtlantaDan

customer_reviews.title: Alexa, turn on the Christmas tree!
customer_reviews.text: Telling Alexa to "turn on the Christmas tree" amazes our granddaughter. I've just started to install other switches and devices. My first hub was defective but that was my fault for purchasing a repackaged item. Amazon issued a refund with no problems and I ordered a new hub. Installation took less than 10 minutes including finding the new receptacle and adding the hub and outlet to Echo.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence R. Mastropolo

customer_reviews.title: Poor Reliabilty
customer_reviews.text: I bought a hub directly from Smart Home and it worked great for almost 3 years. I am on my second hub purchased through Amazon and both worked for a couple weeks and then began to “hang” with a red led showing. A reboot clears the hub however it hangs again in a couple days. I wonder if these are refurbished products. I am going to return and try one directly from Smart Home.
customer_reviews.author: LK

customer_reviews.title: I have had it for many many months, it works about 80% of the time. The other 20% and I just leave the lights off.
customer_reviews.text: I have had it for many many months, it works about 80% of the time. The other 20% and I just leave the lights off. EDIT: It Eventually stopped working entirely. Setting it up is so complex, that I am throwing out my 2 dimmers, hub and remote, rather than trying to figure out why it stopped working. I'm switching to the Z-Wave standard.
customer_reviews.author: Marvin Lipschitz

customer_reviews.title: It works most of the time. I had an ...
customer_reviews.text: It works most of the time. I had an issue a couple weeks ago where it didn't seem to be connected. None of my other network devices had any issues with connectivity, so I did a hard reset and it seemed to fix itself. That issue hasn't come back, though. Would have rated 4 stars otherwise.
customer_reviews.author: Xalthe

customer_reviews.title: NO LONGER CONTROLS LIGHTS
customer_reviews.text: insteon has DISCONTINUED manufacturing of the proprietary bulbs that are the only light bulbs that work with the insteon hub. their claim "Create customized scenes for instant recalling of your favorite lighting settings, & create schedules for individual devices or scenes " is NO LONGER TRUE DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY
customer_reviews.author: rcb

customer_reviews.title: Works
customer_reviews.text: It works but seriously, no way to back up? Big-time fail. Insteon has a lot less problems than z-wave but had I known there was no backup / restore I would have bought z-wave. Equipment fails, why lose all data when it does?
customer_reviews.author: Traxx

customer_reviews.title: Could be much better
customer_reviews.text: Handy, but very slow and it just died a week ago. Not sure why it is so slow to update all the light status in the app. Maybe its the app that is slow or Insteon protocol itself. either way it takes a couple minutes to check the status of the lights in my house ~30 lights.
customer_reviews.author: Code Cowboy

customer_reviews.title: Can't recommend
customer_reviews.text: Trust the reviews - this is Garbage! Invested in a couple dozen Insteon switches, worst decision I've ever made - half of them have died, was hoping remaining dozen will somehow magically transform into modern smart home. Was able to connect a total of THREE switches, the rest wouldn't pass the connection test - pathetic ! STAY AWAY !
customer_reviews.author: vn2000

customer_reviews.title: Inferior quality.
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of them, neither worked. I’m very disappointed. I’ve git several cameras now that are worthless too.
customer_reviews.author: William Morris

customer_reviews.title: If I didn't need it, I would have bought it.
customer_reviews.text: I wish I didn't need it. Often loses connection, even though hard wired in. There was a known issue with previous model that would brick it completely, making it effectively dead. Another company with bad customer service.
customer_reviews.author: gadgetguy

customer_reviews.title: Dead after 3 years
customer_reviews.text: shoddy quality. Gonna attempt to repair but with the amount of failures they're having, they should perform a recall.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew L Herrold

customer_reviews.title: I returned it....
customer_reviews.text: I order this hub looking to streamline my Smart Home capabilities. My Ethernet connection is upstair... after countless time attempting to connect, Frustration overcame me. The next day, I was determine to connect.... this unit doesn't read wifi, You can connect by item identification, however the Item must be close to the Hub or you can purchase a Extender. It became Frustrating for me. I returned it to Amazon for a refund
customer_reviews.author: Caesar

customer_reviews.title: Not real easy to set up.
customer_reviews.text: Had trouble getting the item to work properly. Finally did.
customer_reviews.author: William Ullrich

customer_reviews.title: Insteon Hub just works.
customer_reviews.text: Insteon finally has a hub that just works. Easy to set up using their mobile app. A great way to configure a RemoteLinc handheld, which are normally very tedious.
customer_reviews.author: CA Guy

customer_reviews.title: Not working for me
customer_reviews.text: Although I have tried all of the manufacturer's troubleshooting, I cannot get the mobile app to discover the hub (which seems to set-up correctly). I'll keep trying, but so far am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Hub keeps losing power
customer_reviews.text: We have a house full of insteon products including cameras we use as baby monitors, light switches and garage openers. Unfortunately we just had our second hub stop working after a little over 2 years on each hub. My brother has had the same problem and just replaced his also. Otherwise we have enjoyed the automation but frustrating to keep replacing the heart of the system.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M davey

customer_reviews.title: Great now that it is working.
customer_reviews.text: Had some troubles at first, but now am controlling my garage, porch lights, and leak sensor. The house of the future is here and I love it! I initially had difficult with schedules of my lights, but that was due to the hub not being on the right time. Had to reset and that seemed to fix it. Now working great!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Device lasted less than three years. Warranty is only ...
customer_reviews.text: Device lasted less than three years. Warranty is only for two years. A simple search of the internet showed that this is a known defect having to do with a capacitor that is known to fail
customer_reviews.author: J. gibson

customer_reviews.title: Great Controller Hub
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and connect. Our application is to have it control two garden fountains. We can turn on/off either one (separately), or both, using the iPhone from anywhere around the world...yes, a bit over the top, but it's nice to make sure we remembered to turn them off when away from the house.
customer_reviews.author: Jean S.

product_meta.title: Insteon Central Controller Hub, Compatible with Alexa, 2245-222
product_meta.description: Style:Hub OnlyInsteon Hub is an Insteon central controller for the rest of us; a simple and straightforward device that connects you to your home from any smartphone, tablet, Amazon Alexa-enabled device or Google Assistant-enabled device. Control Insteon light bulbs, wall switches, outlets, and thermostats at home or remotely and receive instant email or push notification alerts from motion, door and window, water leak, and smoke sensors while you’re away. Just start with the Hub, select the Insteon devices for your home and enjoy.
feature_bullets: The Insteon Hub gives you control over a huge family of connected devices, all from your smartphone and tablet
Create customized scenes for instant recalling of your favorite lighting settings, & create schedules for individual devices or scenes
Get instant alerts from sensors for things like motion, water leaks and doors opening
Control temperature from an Insteon Thermostat (2441TH) or a Nest Learning Thermostat (iOS and Android)
Dual-band works with Amazon Alexa & Google Assistant for voice control (sold separately)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.5 out of 5 stars592 ratings3.5 out of 5 stars
